recipes.title: Fluffy Banana Oat Pancakes
recipes.description: Naturally sweet pancakes made with ripe bananas and soothing oats—perfect for a gentle morning start.
ingredients: 1 cup almond milk (or any non-dairy milk)
instructions: Blend oats in a blender until they form a flour-like consistency.
Add mashed bananas, almond milk, maple syrup, baking powder, cinnamon, salt, and vanilla to the blender.
Blend until smooth and well combined.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and lightly oil if needed.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter for each pancake.
Cook for 2-3 minutes until bubbles form on the surface, then flip.
Cook for another 2 minutes until golden brown.
Serve warm with fresh berries or a drizzle of maple syrup.
recipes.notes: These pancakes are naturally low in acid and gentle on the stomach. Avoid adding citrus fruits as toppings.

recipes.title: Ginger Chicken with Rice
recipes.description: Tender chicken infused with gentle ginger and served with fluffy rice—comforting without the reflux.
instructions: Rinse rice thoroughly and cook according to package directions.
Season chicken breasts lightly with salt.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add grated ginger and sauté for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add chicken breasts and cook for 6-7 minutes on each side until golden and cooked through.
Add chicken broth and simmer for 3-4 minutes.
Serve chicken over rice, drizzle with pan sauce, and garnish with parsley.
recipes.notes: Ginger is known to help with digestion. This mild preparation avoids acidic ingredients like tomatoes or citrus.

recipes.title: Soothing Melon Smoothie
recipes.description: Refreshing blend of melon and banana—a cooling drink that's easy on your digestive system and delicious.
instructions: Add melon cubes, banana, coconut water, and coconut yogurt to a blender.
Blend on high speed until smooth and creamy.
Add ice cubes and blend again until desired consistency.
Taste and add honey if you prefer extra sweetness.
Pour into glasses and serve immediately.
recipes.notes: Melons are low in acid and very soothing. This smoothie is perfect for hot days or as a light snack.

recipes.title: Herb-Roasted Sweet Potato
recipes.description: Simple roasted sweet potato with calming herbs—naturally sweet and satisfying.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Wash and dry sweet potatoes, then cut into 1-inch cubes.
Toss sweet potato cubes with olive oil, rosemary, thyme, and salt.
Spread on a baking sheet in a single layer.
Roast for 35-40 minutes, flipping halfway through, until tender and golden.
Garnish with fresh herbs and serve warm.
recipes.notes: Sweet potatoes are alkaline and very gentle on the stomach.

recipes.title: Calming Chamomile Blend
recipes.description: A gentle herbal tea blend to soothe your stomach and relax your mind.
instructions: Heat water to about 200°F (just below boiling).
Place chamomile tea bag in a cup.
Pour hot water over the tea bag.
Steep for 5 minutes.
Remove tea bag and add honey and mint if desired.
Sip slowly while warm.
recipes.notes: Chamomile is known for its calming properties and is gentle on the digestive system.

recipes.title: Gentle Zucchini Noodles
recipes.description: Light veggie noodles with mild herbs—a fresh, low-acid pasta alternative.
instructions: Spiralize zucchini into noodle shapes using a spiralizer.
Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and sauté for 1 minute.
Add zucchini noodles and toss for 2-3 minutes until just tender.
Remove from heat and stir in fresh basil.
Season with salt and sprinkle with nutritional yeast if desired.
Serve immediately.
recipes.notes: Zucchini is very low in acid. Avoid adding tomato sauce; use olive oil and herbs instead.

recipes.title: Creamy Coconut Rice
recipes.description: Smooth coconut-infused rice that's gentle on digestion and rich in flavor.
instructions: Rinse rice thoroughly under cold water.
In a medium pot, combine rice, coconut milk, water, salt, and coconut sugar.
Bring to a boil over high heat.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 18-20 minutes.
Remove from heat and let sit covered for 5 minutes.
Fluff with a fork and garnish with cilantro.
Serve warm as a side dish.
recipes.notes: Coconut milk adds creaminess without dairy, making this dish gentle and satisfying.
